campaign.story:
Are you looking for a tool to help you live your most brave and creative life? Do you love affirmation decks, inspirational quotes, and motivational sayings to help get your through your day? Are you looking for a coach to walk you through your goals and next steps?  
If so, then we created this deck for you. This deck is a passion project from coaches Heather Vickery and Rachel Swanson. Together we have spent a year designing and developing this manifestation deck, all with the goal of give you the tools you need to source your next steps in life and career. 
The Deck:
48 Cards printed on luxuriously thick 400 GSM card stock
Cards finished with soft matte lamination and colored (or glitter) edges. (See stretch goals!)
Beautifully designed box with a lid.
Paper guidebook that fits inside the box 
About the Deck:
Our goal was to design a deck that was like having two coaches in your corner. Heather is in the business of BRAVE, helping people find their most courageous and brave paths. Rachel is in the business of CREATIVITY, helping people build lives that engage their creative spark. Together, we want to help you CREATE BRAVE. 
This deck has 48 cards. Each card has a different word and image that you can use to guide your work for the day or week. Under the word there is a phrase that you can use as encouragement as you live into the message of the card. 
Included in the deck is a guidebook. The guidebook will give practical support and ideas as you live your creatively brave life. Each card will have a description, ideas for next steps, and a question to use as a prompt for journaling and reflection. 
The card artwork is beautiful, abstract enough to let you make your own associations with the words on the cards. 
Here are the cards: 
Using the Deck: 
You can use the deck in many ways! Here are a few of our ideas: 
Draw a card each day to use as a frame to guide your day
Look through the deck and choose the card that most resonates with you and reflect on how that idea is showing up in your life
Leave a card on your desk as a conversation starter with colleagues or clients
Choose a card each day as a journaling prompt
Read the guidebook cover to cover and make a collage out of the cards. Hey, there are no rules!
Thank you so much for supporting our project! We are thrilled to be on the journey of Creating Brave with you. 

STRETCH GOALS!
We have some BIG goals for this project! Here are a list of stretch goals that we can unlock!

$10,000: Glittered card edges!
$12,500: Box upgrade! The card deck will be upgraded to a magnetic closure box lid.
$15,000: Workbook: Everyone who purchases the CREATE BRAVE deck will receive a digital workbook that will include printable sheets for each card. 
$20,000: Website: Bring the CREATE BRAVE website to life. At this level we will publish a website full of digital content for the cards. This will include a digital copy of the guidebook, the workbook page for each card, and more!
$25,000: Workshop: At this level, everyone who has purchased the CREATE BRAVE deck will be invited to a live workshop with Rachel and Heather, guiding you through activities for building your creatively brave life. Includes Q&A, session materials, and access to the recording for a limited time. 
$30,000: Printed Workbook: Everyone who purchases the CREATE BRAVE deck will receive a printed copy of the workbook with their order
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are thrilled to have you on this journey with us. All projects come with some level of risk. For our project, the biggest risks are the timing of the printing of the cards and guidebook. COVID and the occasional sideways ship blocking world trade can mean that the project is delayed. We anticipate that the cards will be available by December of 2021, and we hope they arrive sooner. However, for now we are saying that we are confident they will arrive no later than April 2022. Please note that shipping times may vary, especially when shipping outside of the United States.

Hello Everyone! Happy June!

As promised, we wanted to announce the two bonus cards that will be in all the Kickstarter decks. We put our heads together, and looked over every suggestion from all of you, and these were the two words we chose:

In this last day we are sharing as much as we can to unlock the next stretch goal: a digital workbook for each of the cards. Thank you to all of you for sharing, too! We see your posts and emails and it fills us up with gratitude each time.

updates.update_content: We just got our 200th backer for the Create Brave deck, and we are doing a little dance of celebration and appreciation. Thank you to all 200 of you. We see your names and feel incredibly grateful that you believe in Create Brave.

We are thrilled to update that the second stretch goal is unlocked, and the decks will all have magnetic closure boxes!! We’re so jazzed by this, and can’t thank you enough for backing this project and believing in Create Brave. Thank you, thank you, thank you!!

updates.update_userinfo: We hear you! We're keeping both cards, and we're thinking about adding two more as a Kickstarter exclusive! (What do you think?)
updates.update_content:
THANK YOU for all the feedback about the Crumbling and Unravel cards. We got so much feedback, and we heard you loud and clear--you want both cards! We are going to go back and tweak the specific messages a little to make sure they are clear, but they are both going to stay. 
Meanwhile, this has got us thinking, and we want to add two cards to the deck!

It's hard to believe there is only one week left in our Kickstarter! We're planning to end things with great momentum, and we thank you for being one of our backers! 
(Read to the bottom of this update to see an important poll about two of the cards from the deck, we need your input!)
Do you have a friend, family member, client, or coworker who would love this deck? We'd love to have you share this Kickstarter with them. We're less than $1,500 away from having the magnetic closure box, and we are certain we can hit this next stretch goal!

updates.update_userinfo: Process Update: But how do you make a deck?
updates.update_content:
Hello and happy Friday! We've been getting some great questions about the process we used for making out deck, so we wanted to dedicate this week's process update to some Q&A about the deck creation. 
Q: How did you decide to do a 48 card deck?
A: We knew we wanted to do a deck, and we wanted to use words that especially resonated to us as coaches and as entrepreneurs. The first thing we did was choose the words for the deck. We brainstormed a list of words together, writing down everything without editing. Once we had our list of over 60 words, we each ranked the words individually on a scale of 1 to 5.

campaign.story:
The Kickstarter Bulletin is a free magazine published every Tuesday morning compiling all Live and Upcoming games projects for the week ahead. It's published in 4 flavours to help you filter out the stuff that doesn't interest you much and leave you with the stuff that does.
4 great flavours
The magazine is a great resource for everyone involved with games on Kickstarter, whether you are a potential backer, a media bod or a project creator. You really have to see the magazine to understand how helpful it is.
The archives go back to August 2020
The Bulletin was launched in August this year, and since then I have had an overwhelming amount of praise from people including project creators and super-backers. Despite this, not many people have even heard of it.

It's going to take time for the magazine to build some traction and the word to spread, but based on the 100% positive and frequent feedback I'm receiving each week, this magazine is useful and wanted. 

So now I'm asking for your help to keep the magazine going into 2021. If I can raise just a small amount I can keep on putting the work into producing the magazine each week. 

If we make the funding goal I will publish future issues and the back catalogue to DriveThru RPG as PWYW (Pay What You Want) which means you can still get it for free.
I figure people may find this easier than bookmarking the website.
Available as an A4 Wall Calendar or an A5 Desk Calendar
As a little thank you I am producing a 2021 Kickstarter Bulletin calendar. Each month will display a selection of project images from the same month in 2020 as a reminder of just how much stuff is going on every month on Kickstarter.
You can choose an A4 Wall Calendar or an A5 Desk Calendar, or just make a donation to support the project. Whichever choice you make will contribute about £10 to help fund the magazine into 2021.

If you haven't seen the magazine, scroll down to read more and find out why this is worth supporting.
Probably the greatest Kickstarter games resource in the world, probably.
Each week The Bulletin collects the crucial information for every project launched on Kickstarter in the Games category (or one of it's sub-categories).

A new category is assigned to each project to allow us to group similar things together.
The results are split into 4 magazines with projects going into the most logical fit and some projects going into more than one magazine.

More than 600 games projects are launched each month, now we can browse them like we would in a shop or a catalogue.
The content page from the RPG Bulletin
As the Contents page shows, The Bulletin gives us an awesome overview of the projects which might interest us and are Live right now.
An example of a Live Project listing
The clear, concise project listings, along with the categorisation help you to skip sections, skim others and zero-in on the stuff that really interests you, making the whole experience quicker and more enjoyable.
An example Upcoming Project listing
The Live and Upcoming listings include links to to the project on Kickstarter, so if you see something that interests you, just click to visit the project.

A 2-page spread from the Video Games Bulletin
Live projects are collected up to midnight on Monday
The magazines are published to the website early on Tuesday morning (usually by 6am GMT).
 All magazines are available for free download from the website,
The archive goes back to the 3rd of August 2020.
The Kickstarter Bulletin is
good for creators,
good for backers,
good for Kickstarter,
good for everybody,
and it's free.
Why is this worth supporting?
By making a donation you help to support the production of the magazine and ensure it keeps going as a free resource into 2021.

I first started to compile Kickstarter data for my own research into miniature projects. I realised straight away that this data could be enormously helpful to others in the community. Over the last year I have streamlined the data collection process and refined the publications to produce The Kickstarter Bulletin.

I believe The Bulletin is an invaluable resource to the whole gamer community on Kickstarter (which is a significant portion of Kickstarter as a whole). It is my hope to continue to publish the magazine for free into 2021 and for as long as it is relevant and useful. I can only do that with community support.

This is an independent mission, I am not affiliated with Kickstarter other than they are aware of my projects and approve them for launch. I believe the magazine is a benefit to Kickstarter by helping to introduce backers to relevant projects and by providing new-comers an easier access to the Kickstarter platform.

campaign.story:
Try to match what is secretly written with a card from your hand. Your only clue is context!
What would you whisper in the ear of a lover? Probably not what you would yell at Grandma's birthday party!
Write a response to a funny situation card, then rip the quotation out of context and throw it into a hilarious new light! 
Player contribution means the game will never be the same!
From the first prototype on badly cut cardstock, to our most recent design we are sending to our manufacturing team, the game has gone through substantial change, but the core has always been the same. 
Gameplay
Bill reveals a prompt card: "A failed Valentine's card"
Then he writes in secret "I used to love you"
Every other player then adds a card from their hand, without seeing what Bill wrote!
Bill reveals what he wrote, then flips and reads the cards. Now, "I used to love you" becomes:
Everyone votes for their favorite switchuation, then the next player takes the pen and writes for a new prompt. First to five points wins!
Since the players provide the punchline ripped out of context, each time you play, it will never be the same!
The game is simple, but new every time you play!
PLAY


At Definitely Not Evil Labs, we are all about the gaming experience. Switchuations is our contribution to the party game world, and we are excited for you to try it! We have created and culled hundreds of cards to give you the best game possible. We love it, our playtesters have loved it, and we are sure you will love it too!
Pledge Levels

About The Team
In April 2018, Definitely Not Evil Labs was born. Each member of the lab is a nerd of the highest caliber. Our studio strives to design innovative games to influence the gaming world.
It’s a kind of payback: The nerd world has deeply influenced each of us.
We are excited to be involved in new projects of various stripe and genre, and have five or six games in prototype at any given time.
Relax! We’re Definitely Not Evil.
The DNELabs Team. (Not pictured: Cam B. and Zack O.)
Check out our website for more information about each individual member of the team. WWW.DefinitelyNotEvilLabs.com
if you have any questions, concerns, or just want to chat, email us at info@definitelynotevillabs.com or message us on Facebook!
Each game includes 200 Situation cards, rules, a dry-erase marker and our innovative box!
The box design is a major contribution to the game! The Double Speech Bubble is a super-durable dry-erase surface! So, instead of a white board that you might lose, just write inside the speech bubble!! 
The angular cut of the lid lets it rest on the table to display your masterpiece!
Reviews
Christopher Bowden from Winter Moon Games previewed Switchuations after PAX Unplugged. Check it out below then visit his website WWW.WinterMoonGames.com!
Spoiler alert: He really liked it! 
"I played Switchuations with my friends at the local game store.  It was a lot of fun.  A serendipitous find was in the person who felt that they were not creative.  Whenever he wrote a simple prompt, apologetically because he felt he was not creative, those turned out to be incredibly funny and garnered the most laughs.  It's a great game with a simple learning curve."   - Dr. Andrew W.     Rating: 10 / 10
"A varied game of humor and creativity. Great for any group, easy to setup and highly replayable."  - Jacob B.     Rating: 8 / 10
"This game is hilarious. It is as family appropriate and/or raunchy as you want it to be. You create the scenarios as you play. Switchuations is a must-have for every family game room and house party."  - Scott H.     Rating: 10 / 10
"Some of the most original laughs I have ever had! We had such a good time, I honestly wish we could've streamed longer. I can't wait to play Switchuations with my family this Christmas!" - Jaraxlle     Rating: 10 / 10
Overkick Stretch Goals 
If we fund at $7001 or more, we will reveal the stretch goals for $10,000 and $15,000!
$7001 - Reveal the next stretch goals
$10,000 - Hidden
$15,000 - Hidden
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge we face is the time in manufacturing. We are working with a leader in the game manufacturing industry to help mitigate this risk. There is always the chance that the manufacturing goes longer than we were quoted. Hopefully our timeline will absorb the potential excess.
Our cards are written, our box is designed, and our art is ready to go. The only other limitation would be with the backers who are helping us write custom cards, if our collaboration ran long.

campaign.story:
Population: Boom! or Doom?  is a resource management and area control game to where each player is trying to maximize their ability to increase the population they gain for their faction while minimizing their opponent's gain.  During this time players will either benefit or suffer the wrath from a Boom! or Doom? card that is triggered at specific points (five times per game).  The game is continuously evolving as players also draw into a smaller Blessing or Ruins in the deck that has similar effects as a Boom! or Doom?, but has less of an overall impact.   Lastly, the game is fluid with two events that are in play shortly after the start of the game that are phased out as new events are triggered to adjust various aspects of game play.  Events may modify the amount of TRV players increase or decrease on specific territories to gaining or losing your population as well as modifying Agent movement and more effects!

campaign.story:
Designed by Andrew Nerger and Jeffrey Chin (creators of Crypt) and illustrated by Ben Ortiz, Afternova is a negotiation game for 3 to 6 players with easy-to-learn rules and highly interactive gameplay. Check out the rulebook to learn more.
Plus, its compact size makes it easy to put in your bag and take it anywhere!

Watch our Full-Playthrough Video on Facebook Live
On your turn you may extract Fragments from a planet by employing Hired Paws whose total skill values meet or exceed the planet’s skill requirement. You may work alone and extract all the Fragments (if you can afford to do so) or, more likely, you may need to negotiate with one or more players to meet the requirement.
When working with other players, all teammates must agree on how to split the Fragments. Once all teammates agree, play the Hired Paws and collect the agreed upon Fragments.
Or spend your turn acquiring 3 new cards by taking any combination of Hired Paws or Blueprints from the market.
Complete Blueprints by discarding the indicated Fragments. Each Blueprint completed gives you a new ability and scores you victory points. The game ends when a player completes their 6th Blueprint.

campaign.story:
Dungeon Brawler takes the dungeon crawl game genre and mashes it with side-scrolling beat 'em up brawler arcade games from the 80's and 90's. Players each control a hero, arrange them in a formation, and prepare for the oncoming waves of monsters, traps, treasure. If they can survive this automatically-advancing onslaught, then they win as a team.
Each player controls one hero. Each hero represents a different theme: chaos, order, harmony, or discipline. Their hero choice decides their starting deck of cards. Each different theme has a different playstyle, but also informs what future cards they can add to their deck.  
Across from the party line-up is the deadly dungeon itself. Whenever a card is removed from the dungeon, be it by killing a monster, the dungeon automatically shifts towards the players. This  game is incredibly fast-paced: no moving, exploring, or down-time. This dungeon is coming at you full-speed!
Fighting is resolved by playing unique combinations of cards, but be careful! Your hand of cards is also your lifebar! Overextend and you’ll leave yourself vulnerable.
You can try our game for free.  Download the Print-and-Play beta now and start playing. 
We believe in our product so much that we are offering free shipping worldwide.  We want to get this game in the hands of as many players around the world as possible.
Shipping costs are included in your pledges for this campaign. You will NOT be charged for shipping later, once rewards are ready to ship. This INCLUDES S&H + VAT.

campaign.story:
Samples painted by Adam Sadler and Allyssa Perry. Miniatures come unpainted.
Altar Quest is a cooperative game of fantasy adventure inspired by the classic dungeon crawling board games that many of us grew up with. Using the Modular Deck System (MDS), introduced in Street Masters and Brook City, the game features incredibly modular gameplay using several different types of decks. Hero decks, threat decks, villain decks, and quest decks can all be mixed and matched along with altar cards, feature cards, and other game elements to create countless combinations of unique adventures. With an engaging one-off experience and narrative campaign play, Altar Quest offers players endless adventure in a unique fantasy setting with years of support planned for the game.
Whether playing an individual quest or part of a campaign, each quest is made up of a combination of several different decks and other game elements. Heroes must complete the goal set out by the chosen quest deck in order to win the game. They must overcome several obstacles during the quest determined by the chosen threat deck and villain deck, as well as the deck of lurker cards. If any hero is defeated, the heroes lose the game.
All Original Fantasy Setting
Altar Quest takes place mainly in a realm called Aridika—a land of high fantasy and Gothic horror. As players dive deeper into the game, they’ll learn about the deep lore and many mysteries that hide within the shadows of Aridika and the world of Rhuna. Designers Adam & Brady Sadler have been developing the world of Rhuna since their early days of playing Dungeons & Dragons, and are excited to share it and expand it with Altar Quest.
Altars
The world of Rhuna was created by powers called “rhunes”—godlike essences that came together to create all existence. Mortals were never intended to wield the untempered powers of rhunes, so they were crystallized deep within the earth to keep the lands above in balance. Unfortunately, evil finds a way, and deep below Aridika where the lich queen Szera slumbers, the rhunestones have been corrupted and forced to the surface. These altars are worshipped by power-hungry opportunists that use the rhunic energies surrounding them to further their own nefarious plans… 
During each quest, the chosen altar card will constantly affect the state of the altar pool. The altar pool is made up of 5 altar dice that are rolled at the start of the quest. Each altar die has 6 unique sides, each one containing a rhune symbol. These rhunes are used by the heroes, as well as the enemies, to trigger special effects. After an effect is triggered by a rhune symbol, the altar die showing that symbol is rolled and the new symbol is added to the altar pool. Players will have to balance using their rhune effects with making sure they aren’t empowering the enemy too much.
Incredibly Modular
Featuring the versatile Modular Deck System (MDS) that the Sadlers first introduced with Street Masters, the variability of Altar Quest is one of its key features. Players will have a world to explore by mixing hero decks, villain decks, threat decks, and quest decks with fluctuating feature decks to keep the environments fresh. Players can create their ideal game scenarios by matching up decks of their choice, or leave it to fate and embark on a randomized quest!
Truly Solo, Truly Cooperative
Altar Quest features an elegant player scaling solution built into the core design of the game, which means one player can play the game as easily as up to four, with no exceptions or special rules. 
Three Great Ways to Play
While Altar Quest is designed to be a satisfying one-off adventure, players can also embark on an epic campaign by linking their quests together, earning upgraded cards for their decks, finding new equipment, and facing new challenges with enemy upgrades. Additionally, stories allow players to explore the vibrant setting of Aridika by playing through a story deck using the campaign rules.

Risks and challenges
Following our successful campaigns for Street Masters, Brook City, and Street Masters: Aftershock we continue to learn about how better to improve our marketing, design, manufacturing, fulfillment, and distribution, as well as how best to nurture our growing community. Street Masters and Brook City have been fulfilled and have received high acclaim by reviewers and gamers alike.
Currently, Aftershock is in production at the manufacturer. Per our recent updates, we've approved all samples and they are in mass production, about 5 months early! Altar Quest is extremely exciting, but we are also just as excited and committed to bringing Street Masters: Aftershock to our backers' tabletops as soon as possible.
There are a lot of moving parts with Kickstarter campaigns, and timing is often one of the biggest obstacles, especially for smaller publishers such as ourselves. Fortunately, we've got experienced game designers working hard to ensure the gameplay offers the best experience it can, we have strong relationships with the factory/manufacturer, we have a shipment/fulfillment company already signed on, we are completely passionate about our games, and, most importantly, we care about our backers and their satisfaction.

Since the day you were born, you only had one goal: to get into the highest ranked university in the world.  
Some of the art, drawn by Lana Millman
Daggers High takes a satirical look at how cutthroat and backwards college admissions have become. It is a competitive euro board game for 1-4 players, and features elements of card drafting, action point allocation, tableau building, and more. The game features 84 unique and fun illustrations drawn by a high school student.

Shipping
Shipping will be free anywhere in the US. International shipping will be charged after the conclusion of the campaign. We do not expect to receive many international orders, so we plan to use first class USPS international shipping to fulfill any international orders. Please note that this these shipping costs are simply estimates, and are subject to change on a case-by-case basis.
US: Free
Canada: $10

World-wide: $30-40
We expect to have copies in your hands by December 2019. This gives us 2 months to prepare the final files and begin manufacturing, 2 months to manufacture the product, and an additional 2 months to ship the game.
Stretch Goals?
None! We decided against stretch goals as we didn't want to hold any of the awesome content in Daggers High hostage. You will get everything included if you back our Kickstarter regardless of whether we reach an arbitrary goal or not. That doesn't mean we aren't planning on having some awesome updates for you to share, including more cards and other cool things. The more we fund the better we can make the game, so please don't hesitate to share your excitement with your friends! Have any comments on what you'd like to see us add or change? Leave a comment in the comment section and our team will address it!
Budget
The funds from the Kickstarter will be used to complete a print run of the game. We have received different quotes from several manufacturing companies, and will work with them depending on the results of the Kickstarter. Any excess funds will first be used to cover expenses such as prototyping, advertising, and art, and then be used to begin development of other games and/or pursue further distribution of Daggers High.
Our Story
Daggers High is a fictional school, but is loosely based off of Walter Payton College Prep in Chicago, Illinois. It was here that two high school seniors had the idea of creating a satirical board game about the college admission process that they themselves were going through at the time. Since then, Daggers High has been played by over 100 different people. We are excited to have the opportunity to bring it to your table as well!

Risks and challenges
As this is our first ever Kickstarter, we took great precaution in mitigating our risks. One potential risk would be stretch goals and additional content throwing off our pricing estimates. By not having stretch goals, we significantly mitigate this risk. Another potential risk is underestimating the cost of shipping, particularly with international shipping. We are not totally immune to this effect, but we have taken steps to ensure that we have enough buffer room to cover an unexpected rise in shipping costs. We also have priced international shipping at the rate of first-class international mail. 

Returns and refunds: if you would like to cancel your pledge after the conclusion of the Kickstarter and before shipment of the product, we will refund your entire pledge minus any fees from Kickstarter. Once you have received your product, we are prepared to offer replacements for damaged or missing components. We may ask that you provide a photo and/or compensate shipping costs in this case (there will be no shipping cost in the case of a manufacturing defect). If you receive the game and decide that you no longer want it, we will offer returns up to 1 month after you receive the game. campaign.story:
Goblin Phase: In the Goblin Phase, all players gain 4 goblins. They may play these goblins in their Encampments however they like. (1 / 3, 2/2, 4/0). Players may also purchase upgrades at this time.
Movement Phase: Starting with the player with the King's Ear, all players in turn order move their goblins one hex toward the castle. If the goblins are next to a castle unit at the beginning of the movement phase they will not move. At the end of each player's turn if that player has a goblin next to a castle unit, count the total number of goblins surrounding it. If the number meets or exceeds the goblin icon number on a castle unit, that unit is destroyed and that player gets a stone.
Castle Phase: The player with the King's Ear flips the top card of the Castle deck and takes whatever action is shown. (For instance, if they flip a Castle Unit, they would put a Castle Unit hex into play.) Then starting with the player with the King's Ear, players may purchase castle cards with stones that they may play or hold in their hands. Each castle card costs +1 stone for a player to buy, so the first player to buy a card costs 1 stone, the next costs 2 stones, until all players pass.
Conflict Phase: In the conflict phase, the castle will kill 1 goblin in each hex adjacent to it. All castle units will also kill goblins based on their attack regions and range. (See above, the archer kills 2 goblins in each hex in a straight line of 5 hexes. The knight kills 2 goblins in each hex adjacent to it in a 3 region arc.)
Victory: At the end of your movement, if you have at least 1 goblin next to the castle, and there are  5x the number of players in goblins surrounding the castle, the castle is destroyed. (If there are 3 players and I have 5 goblins next to the castle at the end of my movement, and the other players have 10 or more, we have hit the victory condition of 15 and I win because I was the last player to end my movement phase at the target number.)

US Tariffs on Toys:
We understand backers' fear of the US proposed tariffs on toys (including boardgames). We were afraid too BUT we took that fear and decided to do something about it!
For anyone who may have missed it, the US has proposed a new tariff/tax on toys coming from China of up to 25%. That means companies could have to pay up to 25% on the manufacturing cost (not the MSRP or KS pledge price) to have the games released from US customs. 
We discussed and debated this new challenge thoroughly and have come up with a plan to move forward.
Vesuvius Media  is making a commitment to absorb the cost of up to 25% new US tariffs that may be implemented following this Kickstarter campaign. Each company must do what is right for their specific circumstances, and we are making this right for us.
Vesuvius Media is a small game development company. Make no mistake, if the tariffs go into effect, they will eat into any profits we hope to make; BUT we are committed to our community of players, we are grateful for your continued support, and we want to keep our games as accessible as possible.

Vesuvius Media is a small (but mighty!), Canadian, indie development company. Starting off by producing online strategy games, Vesuvius Media has branched into new areas of production and currently boasts online games, mobile games, graphic novels and board games in its portfolio.
What makes Vesuvius Media different from all the other companies? Vesuvius Media is community-driven. Whether online or on the table, its game designers and developers interact with players, listen, debate, and continually gather feedback. Its community of players help shape the future of its games!

GDPR and Data/Privacy Protection law
By pledging on this campaign, you give us the right to transfer your personal data to selected partners, in the sole purpose of sending you your games. We never sell your data to anyone, and we won't transfer it to partners who aren't involved directly in fulfilling your pledge. In details, your personal will be handled by:
us, Vesuvius Media, to transfer it to the partners who will need it
a Pledge Manager solution (we use Hive - www.hiveinteractive.net) to collect your shipping address and pledge preferences
the fulfillment company in charge of shipping the game to you (we work with Quartermaster Logistics for US, Snakes&Lattes for Canada, GamesQuest for UK, VFI for Asia/Australia/Brazil and HappyShops for Rest of EU/Rest of the World)
the transporter chosen by the fulfillment company to deliver you the game (FedEx, UPS, DHL, etc.)

Please note that while GDPR only applies to the European Union, for simplicity and because GDPR globally gives a much better protection for customers, we will apply the principles of this law no matter where you live in the world.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
PLEASE READ THIS SECTION CAREFULLY BEFORE PLEDGING TO THIS CAMPAIGN.

PRODUCTION RISKS

Even though we do our best to ensure a quality product and a timely production, there is always the risk of delays. Supplier shortage, holiday traffic and weather conditions are just a few of the reasons a production could be delayed. Vesuvius Media Ltd should not be held responsible for delays caused by third parties. In addition, some of the items shown might differ from the final product due to supplier/manufacturer limitations.

MISSING/DAMAGED ITEMS

When dealing with a large number of orders, there is always a chance that errors will occur. If after you receive your order, you find that there are items missing, please contact us at support [at] vesuviusmedia.com and we will send you the missing items as soon as possible.

If your package arrives damaged, please take a few photos of all damaged items and email them to us at support [at] vesuviusmedia.com. We will send you replacements for the damaged items as soon as possible.

DELIVERY DATE

Our current estimation for delivery is January 2020. We want your orders to be delivered on time as much as you do; however, history has shown that despite the best laid plans there is always a chance of delay.

UNDELIVERED ITEMS

If a package is not delivered due to a backer's fault (wrong address given, backer didn't claim the delivered package from their post office, etc), the backer may be requested to pay additional shipping fees for the item to be sent out again.

DELIVERY ADDRESS

When this campaign is over, you will be requested to complete a survey in our pledge manager through which you can let us know which items you have ordered as well as where you would like us to ship your order. Keep in mind that your order may be shipped sooner or later than the estimated delivery date. Please give us an address that will surely not change (If for example you think that you may be moving to a new house in January, please give us the address of a friend or relative to ensure a successful delivery).

SHIPPING

Please read the Shipping section above.

ORDER FULFILLMENT

Please note that your order may be delivered in multiple packages. This is done due to weight limitations for group shipments. Even though the items you ordered will be shipped at the same time, there is always a chance they will arrive to you several days apart. This may occur due to each country's postal service sort-and-dispatch system.

UPDATES

Through this campaign you may receive updates on Vesuvius Media's other upcoming projects. Such updates will not be frequent.

BY PLACING A PLEDGE ON THIS CAMPAIGN, YOU ACKNOWLEDGE THAT YOU HAVE READ, UNDERSTAND AND ACCEPT THE RISKS & CHALLENGES STATED IN THIS SECTION.

Thank you very much,

Vesuvius Media Ltd.

MonstroCity Shipping Update
As we're sure you're aware, COVID-19 is affecting everything, and regulations are continually changing. We finally have updates from all of our distribution hubs... with some good news and some less good news.

Hello everyone. We hope you are all staying safe and healthy. 
Shipping Status
As we are sure you are all aware, the coronavirus Covid-19, has turned the world upside down. Although MonstroCity left China before the Chinese New Year holiday, its distribution has been affected. We have customs brokers in Europe, Canada and the United States and have delivered thousands of Vesuvius Media games to players worldwide, but this situation is one we have never encountered before.

Australian Shipping
We had to make some changes to the shipping of MonstroCity for Australian backers. The games will now be shipped from Happy Shops in Europe. We are working with our customs broker to provide the most efficient delivery of the games and to keep the shipments customs-friendly. However, if you are in Australia and you are charged customs, please pay the fee and email a copy of the receipt to support@vesuviusmedia.com. We promised customs-friendly shipping to Australia and we will reimburse you if you are charged.

Stay safe everyone and play on!

campaign.story:
Big Bad Con 2019
From its original goal of simply giving the best possible gaming experience to our local gaming community, Big Bad Con has taken its community-building vision closer to heart every year. And every edition has attracted new people who have helped us move in that direction, like a big katamari of awesome. Big Bad Con has become a transformative event that connects people together and builds communities while ensuring that we hold space for folks from marginalized groups and amplify their voices.
This year, we realized that this goal required a more direct effort. We partnered with DC, who launched the Babble On Equity Project as a separate fundraising effort to bring more people of color to Big Bad Con. BEOP was amazingly successful! In just two days, it had surpassed its funding goal, and will be able to bring over 30 people to Big Bad Con. Now we’re more excited than ever to make Big Bad Con 2019 the best it’s ever been. 
Every one of you who buys a badge, makes a pledge, or donates to the scholarship fund is an intrinsic part of making this happen. You form the foundation for not just the awesomeness of the weekend convention but the larger mission of Big Bad Con to make the tabletop and larp community a more inclusive and welcoming space for all.
 Big Bad Con is happening this October 10-13 in Walnut Creek, CA. It's accessible from either SFO or OAK airports, and it's hosted by the Walnut Creek Marriott, where we have over 20,000 square feet of gaming space!
Our initial fundraising goal is $7,500. This, combined with post-Kickstarter badge sales, will offset hotel costs. Every dollar past that helps us bring more amazing events, cool swag, and fantastic people to the con! 
What can you expect at Big Bad Con?
Here's some of the staples of Big Bad Con:
 Phenomenal tabletop game offerings. We’ll have over 400 events; you can see early submissions on our events page. 
 Amazing players and GMs. They are what makes the convention special!
40 private game rooms for RPGs and LARPs. 
 Online registration for games. Have your entire schedule ready when you arrive!
 Games on Demand. Didn't sign up for games in advance? No worries, swing by GoD and pick from our amazing menu of games!
 Big Bad World. Our con-long larp of being awesome to each other. 
 Community Coordinator and Safety Advocates. Folks that are there for you if something comes up.
 Thursday evening social events. Soda pop social, fencing lessons, stitching circles, dance parties, and more!
What’s new this year?
Every year we look back and see what could be done better, here's what new in 2019!
 POC Dinner, an opportunity to meet and mingle with other amazing people of color.
 All Ages Dry Lounge, a chill spot for teens and adults to hang out.
 Expanded Games on Demand, more room, more tables, and more games!
 A new board game library, donated by our friends at EndGame!
 Outreach, we're teaming up with The Game Academy to run some great games for kids before the con!
 Big Bad Game Jam on itch.io, we're collecting fable and folklore inspired games with proceeds from the anthology going to our scholarship program.
 Babble On Equity Project, a fund to bring more people of color to Big Bad Con.  
 Accessibility loaner gamer gear, jumbo dice, braille dice, card holders, dice trays, easy to hold pens and pencils, and more.
 If...when we exceed our initial funding goal, the real fun begins. We'll host special events, commission amazing art, and bring out some wonderful guests!
In addition to our art from Eden Parkinson, we'll commission Jabari Weathers to give us a whole new take on Little Red and The Wolf. Thanks to the wonderful folks at Heart of the Deernicorn, we'll be using that art on new some gorgeous new t-shirts and hoodies. And thanks to the Babble on Equity Project, Jabari will be attending Big Bad Con as well! 
Whitney M. Delaglio (she/her) is a lawful evil game designer, artist, and creator of the brand Little Wish Productions (LWP). She recently finished her first game, Prism, which is an aquatic RPG about sensuality, relationships, and conflict resolution. As a support class in the gaming community, she is an advocator of providing a safe space for intimacy and emotional vulnerability. 
Whitney will be running Prism and a panel on aquatic game content.
Jeeyon Shim (she/her) is a game designer who lives and works in Oakland, California. Her portfolio focuses on teaching players land skills through LARPing, and she designs the breadth of her work to guide players into (re)connecting with the natural world. This August, Jeeyon will be featured as Artist In Residence at Heart of the Deernicorn to host Forest Play: a weekend convention focused on teaching land skills through LARPing. This year at Big Bad Con she will be our keynote speaker and bring a land skills event to the con. In addition to writing games, she works for Trackers Bay (Berkeley, CA) as an outdoor educator, where she coordinates and designs the company’s LARP programming. You can learn more about Jeeyon through her Patreon, Twitter feed, and itch.io pages. 
Hannah Shaffer (they/she) is a game designer and podcaster who makes games about people searching for meaning and connection. As a relative newcomer to the hobby, Hannah likes finding ways to make gaming more approachable and accessible to new people. Hannah is the co-designer of Questlandia and 14 Days, and the designer of Damn the Man, Save the Music. Hannah's currently working on Questlandia 2 and co-hosts the Design Doc podcast, an experimental journey in designing a roleplaying game (almost) live. 
 Han will be running Questlandia 2, Damn the Man, Save the Music, and a panel about designing unfinished games out in the open, for everyone to see and play! 
Brandon Leon-Gambetta (he/him) is a Latinx game designer and media creator most well known for his telenovela-inspired game Pasión de las Pasiones.  He is additionally one of the creators of the Stop, Hack, & Roll podcast network and host of #LatinXplosion an All-New, All-Different, All-Latinx Masks stream.  Brandon aims to create games that mechanically reinforce genre emulation in both theme and feel.  Find out more at brandonleongambetta.com.  
 Brandon will be running Pasión de las Pasiones, Masks: A New Generation, and a Latinx Community and Mentorship panel.
Clio Yun-su Davis (they/she) is a Korean American game designer and writer whose work explores grief, artificial intelligence, existential dread, and Asian and Asian American experiences. They design larps, tabletop roleplaying games, interactive fiction games, and card games, and are the co-founder of Janitor Interactive. Their freeform game The Long Drive Back from Busan won a Golden Cobra Challenge award, and their game about the future of ancestor worship, The Truth About Eternity, is being presented at Fastaval 2019 in Denmark.
Clio will be running But Not Tonight (larp),  No Such Place as Koreatown, her adventure module for Kids on Bikes (ttrpg), and Battle of the Boy Bands (card game).
Albert Kong (he/him) is a carpenter in Corvallis, Oregon, who makes games unprofessionally. He is exploring how players relate to their physical spaces, and how they can use a literacy of games to find liberation in their lives. He wrote The We-ness (Golden Cobra Judges' Choice 2018) as well as many live games for and with the Come Out and Play community. 
Albert will be running Children of the Stone, a game about personal healing, and The We-ness, a game about collective consciousness.
April Walsh (she/her) is a spooky witch who writes queer games about feelings and caring for one another. Her debut game, Thirsty Sword Lesbians, celebrates the power and love of badass queers who will fight if they must, but just as often realize that their rivals aren't all bad... and are kind of hot, now that you mention it. April used to be a swordfighting ballerina, but claims those days are behind her; she has absolutely no idea who that masked heroine with the sword and the tutu might be. 
April will be running her games Thirsty Sword Lesbians and End of the Line.
Avery Alder (she/her) is a queer designer hailing from Sinixt territory. She's the designer of Monsterhearts, The Quiet Year, Dream Askew, Ribbon Drive, and a host of smaller, scrappier projects. In her design and play, she gravitates toward the moody, the personal, and the transformative.
Avery will be running Monsterhearts, Dream Askew, and Ribbon Drive.
Jerry D. Grayson (he/him) has designed and published games since 2002. A pioneer in Afrocentric sword and soul fantasy and Afrofuturism in roleplaying games, Jerry works tirelessly to bring diversity and new voices to the hobby. Flattered that others find his small efforts amusing, his proudest industry works are GODSEND Agenda, HELLAS: Worlds of Sun and Stone, and ATLANTIS: The Second Age. When not creating games that have all uppercase letters in the title, Jerry works on becoming a better human being through acts of civility and kindness to others. 
Jerry will be running HELLAS: Worlds of Sun and Stone RPG and ATLANTIS: The Second Age.
 Alex Rowland (she/they) is an American freeform designer and larp theorist. Her designs feature a reflexive perspective of the medium which focuses on player/character phenomenology and safety. Her scholarship on event safety has been published in both the International Journal of Role-Playing and Nordiclarp.org, as well as featured at the Living Games Conference and Knutpunkt. Notable games include Hlasko, A Lion in Mississauga, and Canned.
Alex will be running A lion in Mississauga, Canned, and Hlasko. 
Kat Jones (she/they) is a queer, Latina game designer, organizer, and scholar of Sociology; Women, Gender, and Sexuality Studies; and Game Design. Whether it’s a game about sex toy parties at a feminist bookstore (Cady Stanton’s Candyland), or discussing the marginalization experienced by zombies in Revived, Kat loves to combine her academic interests with her game design. 
Kat will be running Slayercake, #TheRealColdtown, and Potluck, a storytelling game about food, community, and resistance.
Andrew Gillis (they/them) is a game designer, a cyborg, and a queer human living in Vancouver, Canada. Over the past decade they've worked in video games, table-top RPGs, and community activism. Their game Girl by Moonlight should be coming out in late 2020.
Andrew will be running Girl by Moonlight and making appearances on panels.
Born to internationally known game designers Meg (she/her) and Vincent (he/him) Baker, Sebastian (he/him), Elliot (he/him)  and Tovey (he/him) were doomed to a life full of polyhedral dice underfoot, spontaneous playtests over meals, and shelves and shelves of games of all kinds. It's a rough life, but they make the best of it. At least one of them has been enchanted by the game design fairy; there might still be some chance for the others.
The Bakers will be running these awesome events:
Vincent will run Under Hollow Hills 
Meg will run The King Is Dead and At the Stroke of Midnight 
Meg will run a workshop on mending and basic alteration for LARP costuming and every day.
Meg will run a workshop on Middle Eastern Dance for Everybody 
Sebastian will run PsiRun and The King Is Dead 
The Bakers will host Coffee & Game Design over breakfast on Saturday morning
The Bakers will run audience-participation Murderous Ghosts. 
The Bakers and/or Brie Beau Sheldon will also be hosting the Soda Pop Social!
 Jahmal ‘Mad Jay’ Brown (he/him) is a freelance TTRPG writer and TTRPG evangelist. His credits include Clockwinders, Cortex Prime Supers and he is currently working on a Burning Wheel/Dungeon World ‘zine about rat-folk, wolfen and bad men called By Aecer’s Light. Mad Jay likes games or stories about outsiders and underdogs up against adversity. Outside of gaming he games with his kids, owns a software company (where they game) and he loves his momma …though she doesn’t game, yet.
Jahmal will be running By Aecer’s Light. 
James D’Amato (he/him) is the president of the One Shot Network and host of actual play Shows like “One Shot” and “Campaign.” He’s also the author of The Ultimate RPG Character Backstory Guide and co-designer of Noisy Person Cards. He loves almost every role-playing game and wants specifically you to have a good time playing.  
James will be running Oh Captain My Captain, The Skyjacks Storytelling Game, a panel on podcasting, and another panel on work-life balance! 
Brittanie Boe (she/her) is a writer, photographer and video producer who founded Be Bold Games in 2018. Her passions include her cat Dax, her daughter Hailey, bouldering, and going on adventures to capture the perfect photos on her camera. She writes about her perspective as a Latinx woman in gaming and is passionate about intersectional feminism as well as queer inclusion and advocacy. When she’s not tweeting she’s off in the mountains playing ukulele and singing at the top of her lungs. Bebo will be running Cat Lady, Modern Art, and Azul!
Ash McAllan (she/her) is a cyberfemme anarchoqueer stream queen and designer from Adelaide, South Australia. She runs streaming ttrpg shows on her own twitch channel and is also part of the Actual Play team. Her game design is hyperactive and tireless, bringing social justice to the adventuring table in games like The Republic and In Which We Live And Breathe. She’s pushing the envelope of what a roleplaying game looks like with games like Oracle and Footprints. Ash also makes video games and gets excited about birds a lot. She’ll be running The Republic, In Which We Live And Breathe, and Oracle!  
Maury Brown (she/they) believes in the power of collaborative storytelling to change the world, starting with the hearts and minds of participants.  She's the lead creative and co-founder of New World Magischola, the designer of Immerton, Beat Generation, Inside Avernus and co-designer of A Wolf By Any Other Name.
Maury will be running her edu-larp Public Memory, Magimundi, and a workshop on adding bespoke safety and calibration techniques to your TTRPG or larp.  
K. Tempest Bradford (she/her) is a science fiction and fantasy writer, writing instructor, media critic, reviewer, and podcaster. Her short fiction has appeared in multiple works including Strange Horizons, PodCastle, Sunspot Jungle, In the Shadow of the Towers, and many more. She’s the host of ORIGINality, a podcast about the roots of creative genius, and contributes to several more. When not writing, she teaches classes on writing inclusive fiction through LitReactor and Writing the Other. Tempest will be running her Writing as Other workshop and appear on other panels.  
Big Bad Scholarship ($20 and up)
All funds collected from this pledge will go towards providing free or discounted badges, transportation, and rooms for attendees who would otherwise not be able to attend.
Additionally your name, organization, or cause will appear on the Big Bad Con Hall of Heroes as one of our supporters.

Additionally you'll receive a special Kickstarter-exclusive pin, a 4-day badge to attend the con.
Adding a badge to another pledge: You can add a badge to any other pledge level by increasing your pledge by $60. When the campaign closes and the BackerKit emails go out, you can assign the extra amount to another badge.
Big Bad Online ($65)

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is the ninth year we have hosted Big Bad Con and every year I walk away from it exhausted from the work and elated from the success.

Obstacles we've encountered in the past include the room blocks filling up, unexpected charges from the hotel rooms, t-shirts trapped in FedEx facilities, fires blocking access to the con, lack of food options, hotel rooms becoming unsuitable for use, and last-minute GM cancellations.

While each of these has been a challenge, we've always pulled through. We’ve incorporated as a nonprofit 501c3, expanded our room blocks, navigated through tough hotel negotiations, and called on an array of excellent GMs to run games in a pinch!

I'm confident we can tackle any obstacles that come our way in 2019. We want to deliver the best roleplaying convention experience with you and for you!

campaign.story:
Runika and the Six-sided Spellbooks is a puzzle-solving dice-manipulation game. Play as Runika and her friends as you collect elemental dice, solve puzzles and cast spells!
 Winning depends on strategy, not luck. Dice rolls give you interesting choices, rather than punishing you. Clever use of your dice will determine whether you win or not.
 Cool rotating boards and spatial puzzles. Create runes on a 4x4 spell grid surrounded by a rotating elemental disk. Use the disk to correctly position your elemental dice and match the patterns on the rune cards to earn points and powers.
 Interaction without player hate. Compete for the favour of your professors and to be the first to solve each rune. Player interaction comes from drafting the right dice and occupying worker-placement slots instead of attacking your friends.
* Due to the unreliable nature of some postal systems, I had to increase shipping to Brazil, Argentina and Chile. I'm really sorry about this. :(
Or let Meeple University lead you through the game (using Lucidity dice as prototypes):
Whether you'd like to try the game before you buy it, or you've backed Day One and can't wait for Runika to be delivered, we've put together a couple ways for you to play right now. 
To play Runika right now, you can use:
 Tabletopia: By clicking here, you can play in your browser with your friends, totally free. You don't even need to sign up!
 Lucidity: Six-sided Nightmares: You can use the dice from our last game, Lucidity, to play a print-and-play version of Runika here. Runika's final dice will have different symbols, but this print-and-play allows you to use the ones from Lucidity in their place. Or use this set and about 480 stickers to make your own dice!
 Substituting cards for dice: The print-and-play here allows you to use generic pipped dice to play. It takes up a lot of table space because it replaces 12mm dice with 68mm cards, but it should give you a good sense for the gameplay.
 Solo mode: You can also check out our draft solo mode rules here.
During the campaign, we ran an online narrative for backers to vote on! This story gives you the chance to decide the fate of Runika and her friends.
To begin with the prologue, click here. 



 Social Media Avatars
You can use these banners on Kickstarter, Instagram, Facebook or Twitter to show your support for Runika. They have been designed to fit within a cropped circle (eg on Kickstarter and Instagram). 
To use one on Kickstarter, click on it to go to the enlarged file, right click to save that image to your computer, click on the bubble in the top right corner of your Kickstarter page and go to Settings > Edit profile. You can upload the avatar to there from your computer (look under "Picture").
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my second campaign, and so while some of the risks and challenges are the same, I am better informed this time around!

How much is shipping?

If you scroll up in the campaign, you should find a list of shipping options. I've subsidised most of the options, and given free shipping to the major Kickstarter backing countries, where there are hubs available that reduce shipping costs.

"Why is this in AUD?":

As I live in Australia, my campaigns must use Australian dollars (AUD). You might know it better as "monopoly money". Exchange rates are always going up and down, and I have added a buffer to accommodate for currency fluctuations over the course of the campaign. After the campaign concludes, I will convert the AUD to the various currencies they need to be (USD and GBP mostly). That should cover any further risk, short of Australia becoming a dystopic, Mad Maxian world and abandoning plastic money in favour of gasoline and water.

Shipping:

Things can always happen: ships sink or disappear completely; packages get stuck in customs, only to wash up on lost islands (or in purgatory?) years later; and variations in seasonal freight pricing can lead to drastic increases in shipping costs. I will be ordering excess stock in order to cover lost packages, and there is a buffer in the goal for any increases in shipping.

A note on shipping to certain countries:

While I have made every effort in the past to make sure every backer got their game, sometimes it doesn't happen and I've needed to refund a pledge. I've found this to be the case in countries such as Argentina and Brazil. Because I lost so much money posting to South America in the last campaign, I have to increase the shipping costs to these countries. This also does not cover import tariffs, which are your responsibility, sorry! While I feel terrible to have to do this, I'm just one person and I can't afford to cover the local tariffs that exist in some countries, or account for packages going missing in dodgy postal systems. Rather than exclude shipping to these countries, I've left it available, but with shipping rates reflecting the reality of the situation. I am truly sorry about this.

campaign.story:
Beholden to the gods of dice and dungeons, Eldritch Foundry brings miniatures from the far reaches of the outer planes. But not any miniatures. Our expert team of Gnome Wizards work tirelessly to bring the most customizable and powerful figures for your character. Our sleek, seamless, flash-less miniatures are unrivaled in appearance and each is blessed by a team of Clerics. 
    Can’t find the perfect miniature for your Dwarven Fighter?  
Eldritch Foundry.
    Are the only miniatures available carrying a broadsword instead of a warhammer? 
Eldritch Foundry.
    Is the figure’s beard too short for your perfect avatar? 
Eldritch Foundry.
    Through dark and forbidden rituals, we have given you, the player, the ability to select everything about your character. Complete customization is now in the hands of the player. Whatever hands, head, tail, wings, clothes, weapons, and practically anything else you can think of, we can do. Even the most mundane of coin purses will look amazing on your character – through our high-quality 3D printing.  
 This project combines everything you want from a miniature - the original creative art, with the best quality that can be found for a customized unique printed miniatures.
*Warning: Miniatures may contain bonus Experience Points 
     The Eldritch Foundry has partnered with the leading US 3D printer manufacturer, 3DSystems, and our in-house printers utilize the most advanced technology available on the market. As such, we are printing at a quality that is substantially higher than anyone else. We print at about 40% higher definition than anyone else on the market.
Most miniatures currently available on the market are printed at around 50 microns. An Eldritch Foundry miniature is printed at around 32 microns. In addition, we use wax supports. This process means your miniatures will have no flash, no mold lines, and no seams. 
       Our character creator interface is like nothing you’ve seen before, except perhaps in video games. We have developed a one-of-a-kind character creator to a look and feel that closely resembles the character creators in Baldur’s Gate, Planescape, Torment, or even Skyrim (well, at least the starting bit). The interface is intuitive and easy to use, while providing for a maximum level of customization for your miniature.
    Each and every character choice, from race and class, to armor and weapons, has a unique lore associated with it. We have partnered with several brilliant writers (most notably- the amazing Patrick Stuart!) to create a lore that is as unique as our character creator. 
    This process, from the unique character creator to the expansive and in-depth lore,  makes creating a high quality and custom miniature more immersive and helps create a world-building experience.
       We have developed the first and only conditional marker base for your miniatures. This base allows for the quick and easy identification of conditional statuses of your character, without the need for conditional rings or milk jug rings. The conditions available on your unique Eldritch Foundry miniature base include poisoned, restrained, concentration, deafened, petrified, grappled, blinded, and frightened. We have even provided conditional marker bases that are blank, if you prefer to draw your own. We’ll even have an option where you can choose which conditions you want on your base (but that’s a bit more down the line).
      In order to bring you the finest quality miniatures, every piece is first individually drawn by gentle hands of our Tiefling concept artists. Then, these sketches are animated, given sentience, and turned into 3-dimensional models.  Our miniatures are then crafted from these models by an expert team of Gnome Wizards. This process is designed to bring you the highest-quality, unique, and magically enchanted miniatures possible. 
      To bring you more, we must first provide offerings to the lords of darkness and miniatures, who enslave hapless concept artists for no less than 99 years. These concept artists provide us with all the exquisite art, in order to bring the most realistic and beautifully rendered miniatures to you, the player.  Through this project we intend to bring you more items, races, mounts, perhaps a campaign setting, and even a little thing we think of as "the bits box".
       The Eldritch Foundry's founders are gamers, like you. We would like to let gamers take their character from the imaginary and make them a reality. To provide miniatures of the highest quality, both in the form of the model and in the quality, while using the latest in 3D printing quality available. More than that, table-top gaming is a community experience. As such, we provide services both with online sales and through friendly local gaming stores.  
Enjoyable and intuitive site - for the quick and easy customization of your characters.
Unique and original craftsmanship -of all the items, armor, weapons, clothes, and accessories your character will ever need.
Built-in status indicator bases - for quick and easy identification of character status' 
New origin lore written for Eldritch Foundry - making the character creation process much more immersive and interesting. 
Quality 3D printing - showing the finest detail available on the market, exactly as designed by you, the player.
      The Eldritch Foundry, a group of nerds and geeks dedicated to bringing the most unique and customizable miniatures available. We are committed to improving your games. And we are enthusiastic about our mission.
The Eldritch Foundry loves the TTRPG community- and acts on it with a business model that is geared towards helping your local gaming store thrive. We incentivize foot traffic by offering free shipping if you send your avatar to your local gaming store. We share in every miniature sale made within store grounds, and for every miniature sent to stores.
Retailers- feel free to reach out, we'd love to discuss this in person!
Our partner FLGS, Knight's Watch Games:
  "Eldritch Foundry is a revolutionary company that bridges the gap between producers, retailers and customers.  The ability for a customer to design, purchase and pick-up their customized miniature at the brick and mortar store facilitates better relationships between buyer and seller, guarantees a better shopping experience, and higher customer satisfaction. The immersive process of personalizing a character and reading the powerful descriptions for the various options makes building your dream character super entertaining!" - Brenda and Paraic Mulgrew of Knight's Watch Games
The Eldritch Foundry is a firm believer that the TTRPG community is just that- a community. We strive to work with everybody- from stores, to local artists, to gaming streams, and beyond. As such, we've begun partnering with the D4 D&D stream (go check them out!) to provide their gaming miniatures.
We've also started working with artists from the community which we love- first and foremost- the Griffon's Saddlebag (you can see his Retaliating Shield on some of our minis, even!).
      Based on past experience, we will be charging shipping after the Kickstarter concludes, based on the actual costs incurred to ship. We will collect this via our pledge manager after the campaign ends. This is so we can be fair to all our backers as shipping is rarely one size fits all.
US shipping (to your local gaming store)- FREE!
Rest of the world - shipping will cost $10.
 What is the Eldritch Foundry?
      We are two friends, who quit our day jobs, and founded Eldritch Foundry. We provide miniatures of the highest quality, both in the form of your miniature’s model and in the quality, while using the latest in 3D printing technology available. This process will give your miniatures a sleek, seamless, flash-less appearance not available in any other product on the market.
How do the miniature coupons work?
      All rewards for “custom miniature coupon(s)” are presented as coupons, and as such, are good indefinitely. This allows you to redeem at any point and even for future releases and features.  
When will the Miniatures Ship?
      Tricky question! Our full Character Foundry will be up and running August 1st, when we debut at Gen Con. We are currently gunning for a weeks turnaround (1-2 days to print, 3-6 days of shipping in the US), but a two week turnaround is a bit more likely (especially if we have a huge backlog). 
It should be noted that we will be adding more and more items, races, weapons and… stuff(?) as time progress, so if you have a specific idea for your mini, look up our development schedule on our site!
What about international shipping?
      Shipping to the US is free of charge. Shipping to Western Europe is going to add about 10$ on top of your pledge level.
How do I select more than one pledge goal?
     In Kickstarter you can only really select one pledge goal, but no worries. If none of the pledge levels are just right, pick the one closest to what you want, and you can adjust upwards later in our backer kit. 
Retailers - What are the typical cost of an Eldritch Foundry miniature in a retail store?
      Our current pricing point for a single miniature is about MSRP 35$. The conditional marker base should add another 10$ on top of that. Oversized models will run you about 10$ extra. 
We’re still looking into “bits” pricing and quantities, so that’s a big WIP right now.

Risks and challenges
1) Development challenges

 We have been accepted as exhibitors at Gen Con 2019. As such, we have a hard deadline to have our character creator site up and running by August 2019. With this in mind, our current plan is to launch as soon as possible, with various additional features being introduced later on in the development phase. These additional features, which are being considered non-essential for initial launch, are thus marked down as a phase 2. For example, these additional features consist of features like “bits” purchasing and social media sharing with cool filters are lower on our priority list.
 In all regards, development of the product is largely complete with high-quality highly detailed miniatures. This project is intended to raise capital in financially reasonable way.


2) Asset creation:

 Our asset creation timeline is very much dependent on how successful the Kickstarter campaign is. Our current funding is enough to let us reach Gen Con 2019 with an already assembled asset library of high Fantasy weapon and armor sets, and the base races of Humans, Elves (& half-Elves), Dwarves, Goliaths and Halflings.
 The greater our success, the faster we hope to add additional assets and features to the system. However, there is an upper limit to how fast we can add additional assets, while still maintaining a high-quality of production. We will have a production schedule posted on our home website once we see how far ahead, we are. This will allow Eldritch Foundry fans to come and see new products and plan ahead for when their favorite race and genres come online.

campaign.story:
Brave New Worlds is a tabletop tile-discovery game for 2-6 players. You'll command one of Earth's six most advanced space agencies, racing to deploy Telescopes, Payloads, and your fleet of Spacecraft (Orbiters, Landers, and Shuttles) to discover, orbit, and land on worlds before your competitors.
Make shrewd decisions about how to spend your research budget, strategize how best to deploy your fleet, and be the first to discover what's really out there!  In Brave New Worlds, you can explore every single world ever visited up close by spacecraft.  That means you can send orbiters to Jupiter, land rovers on Hyperion, or set foot on the rocky surface of Ceres - if it exists out there, it's represented in here.
Humanity is counting on you to lead your space agency to glory - are you up to the challenge?
  We're packing a ton of stuff in the Brave New Worlds box!  Over 100 punch-out tiles allow you to build a massive game board for up to 6 players, or a smaller one for shorter games with 2-4 players. You can start with a level playing field (symmetric starting conditions for all players), or try playing with the Advanced Rules, which give every space agency unique, asymmetric abilities inspired by their real-life counterparts (like moon-landing bonuses for the Americans, giant telescopes for the Europeans, and Solar Sailing capabilities for the Japanese). And in every game box you'll get a beautifully-illustrated companion book, packed with real science, describing every world you'll visit.
Here's everything you'll get by backing at the "Discoverer" level, all laid out:
This gif shows a shorter preview version of the companion book. The version included with Brave New Worlds will be about twice as long. To read this preview version of the book, click on the image above!
    Plus all unlocked stretch goals! 
You can check out a preliminary version of the rulebook in PDF form by clicking right here. (Note that these rules and their presentation may be tweaked a bit as the campaign progresses with feedback from backers.) For an overview of the structure of gameplay in Brave New Worlds, check out the section below!
The Playing Surface of Brave New Worlds is divided into 4 regions of randomized tiles, and can be made smaller or larger depending on the number of players:  

Each round, players receive a set budget of 6 Tokens which can be distributed among three different technologies: 

After collecting income, players take turns performing different actions:
 SURVEY: Dropping a telescope on a tile allows you to learn its identity before any other player. But this secret knowledge is only temporary - after one round, all white telescopes flip to black. After two rounds the black telescopes are removed, and the tile is flipped for all players to see.  
 MANEUVER: After dropping telescopes, players can choose to launch spacecraft, move across the placing surface, and land on worlds.  Points are earned by bringing Payloads to the worlds you’ll visit.
At the end of each turn comes SCORING.  Every tile possesses symbols which indicate how many points can be earned for different kinds of missions:  
Which worlds should you target for exploration?  You'll get more points for discovering worlds farther from Earth, but fueling up your spacecraft to reach them can be expensive.
Careful, though - you’re not alone in trying to pry secrets from these worlds!  If another player sends a more complex spacecraft, or one carrying more Payloads, they can knock you from your spot on that world!

At the end of each turn, players advance their marker along the score track. The first player to reach 100 points wins!
Advanced Play - Unique Abilities For Different Space Agencies!
In Brave New Worlds, you can choose to play with either Basic or Advanced rules. In the Basic version, every player starts with the same abilities, and the playing field is even. In the Advanced version, each space agency possesses unique abilities informed by the historical successes of their real-life counterparts:
For a more detailed description of these special abilities, and the real science that inspired them, check out pages 20-26 of the rulebook by clicking on the gif below:
To read these rules for Advanced Play (along with the rest of the rulebook) in detail, click on the image above! (The rules for advanced play are located on pages 20-26.)
  Want to see the game in action? Check out this video from Lance Hinkel at  Learn to Play Games:
What about that book? Brave New Worlds: A Guide to the Solar System 
  Every copy of "Brave New Worlds the Game" comes with a copy of "Brave New Worlds the Book" - a guide to our Solar System, illustrated in high resolution and full color, with amazing facts about every Solar System world ever visited by spacecraft (and all the worlds you'll discover in this game): 
  I've spent nearly as much time working on this book as I have on the game, because I want players who land on worlds they've never heard of to able to say "Wow, Iapetus! I wonder what it's like there...", and then go read about it right away.  You can check out a preview version of this book on the game's facebook page  by clicking this link. 
Interested in knowing what other people are saying about Brave New Worlds? Check out these reviews:
Written 
Click the image above for Gaming With Sidekicks' written review of Brave New Worlds.
  Video
   
I've worked hard to make Brave New Worlds as accessible as possible, because I really want to share with as many people as I can the joy of space exploration and discovery. So in addition to trying to raise money to make this game a physical reality, I've made a digital version that I can give away for free! Click on the image below to get access to files you can print yourself at home in order to make a paper version of Brave New Worlds.
Click the image above to access the preliminary print and play files!
  This version contains everything you need to create and play a version of Brave New Worlds on paper in its prototype form. If you'd like to try 3D printing your own spacecraft, or would like access to the finalized design files when the campaign concludes, consider backing at the $10 Observer Level for access to the premium print-and-play version.
Brave New Worlds is an experience designed not only to be a ton of fun, but inspiring too. We live in an amazing universe, a gigantic place filled will crazy wonders. And it's easy to get excited about that when you start to discover what humanity has learned about it over the past few decades. There's this scene in Carl Sagan's Cosmos where Dr. Sagan visits his old middle school and begins handing out pictures of all the worlds humanity has visited, and it's just so great:
I love seeing how excited those little kids are getting about the solar system! And the amazing thing about that clip is that Dr. Sagan isn't giving a lecture, he's just handing out pictures, inspiring kids to ask their own questions and get excited all on their own.
I think everyone, no matter what age, can feel a bit of that childhood joy when they discover something new about the universe. My initial motivation for making this game wasn't to give an astronomy lesson, but rather was just to say "Hey, look at all these crazy worlds! Imagine what it would be like to discover them for the first time! And wouldn't it be cool if we landed humans on Pluto?" And I thought that wrapping that around a game, and making that game as fun as I could, might be a great way to reach out to as many people as possible.
If you support Brave New Worlds, you'll be getting a great game that is undoubtedly a ton of fun. But you'll also be getting something that will show you how amazing and exciting space really is. Here, let me tell you more:

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always risks in creating something new and releasing it to the world, and I've worked hard to minimize them as much as I can.

On the logistical side, I've been in constant communication with my Chinese manufacturer DoFine Games in order to establish accurate prices for creating each of the components shown on this page. I've also been in contact with several distributors and shipping companies in order to get accurate estimates for how much it will cost to get these games from the factory to my backers' doorsteps. Unexpected costs *can* crop up, and surprises can lead to delays in getting these games into backers' hands, but I've built in a bit of a buffer - I fully expect to be able to deliver games by January 2020 (and hopefully sooner than that!), but rest assured that if delays crop up I'll keep you in the loop by posting regular updates.

On the creative side: the game is 95% done! What remains is to improve the design of a few components, especially the player reference cards and the scoring track. I expect that the design files should be complete by 1 month after the campaign concludes, and if this schedule slips I will post updates.

Finally, there is some work still to be done on the companion book, which is currently still missing several moons and many of the worlds of the asteroid belt. If creative delays pop up it will likely be because of my desire to make this book as beautiful and as detailed as possible. I expect to have the book complete by June, but have agreed with DoFine Games that manufacturing of the other game components can begin earlier than that. I don't expect that delays in producing the book will affect production of the game, and I will keep you informed with regular updates.
